result.execSummary:
Michael Scott Donovan was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael Scott Donovan was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Scott Donovan

records.addlTxt: 01:51 PM Defendant Michael Scott Donovan in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def identifies himself.  Def advised of rights.  Def indicates he's not on probation for Count indicated.  Court questions DA.  DA clarifies on record.  Judge explains further to def.  Def indicates he wants to waive extradition.  DA has colliquoy for Court.  Consent provided to def for review and signature.  Def understands why he is in custody.  Court goes through information with def.  Def understands.  No coercion to get def to waive extradition.   Court goes through waiver with def.  Court asks def to check boxes on consent if appropriate.  Def doesn't have any questions.  Court recieves waiver checked by def.  Def wishes to waive extradition to MN.  Nothing further.  Adj.  2:03 p.m.  klr
